starvationevasion.sim.util

Class MapConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.sim.util.MapConverter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EquirectangularConverter

    public abstract class MapConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by winston on 1/23/15. Phase_01 class is used to convert between the spring2015code.model and the GUI for converting between lat lon to x, y and back.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapConverter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract double getHeight()
      Returns the height of the projection of this converter.
      abstract java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Line2D> getLatLonGrid()
      Returns a conventional grid in latitude and longitude as defined by the converter.
      abstract java.awt.geom.Dimension2D getProjectionDimensions()
      Returns the dimensions of the projection of this converter.
      abstract double getScale()
      Factor that the map points are scaled by.
      abstract double getWidth()
      Returns the width of the projection of this converter.
      abstract double latToY(double lat)
      Converts a latitude point to a y value.
      abstract double lonToX(double lon)
      Converts a longitude point to a y value.
      abstract java.awt.Point mapPointToPoint(MapPoint mp)
      Converts a point on a map given in latitude and longitude, and transforms it into an x,y point on a Cartesian system, suitable for drawing.
      abstract MapPoint pointToMapPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D p)
      in the inverse function of mapPointToPoint.
      abstract java.awt.Polygon regionToPolygon(GeographicArea r)
      Transforms the given GeographicArea object into a polygon suitable for drawing.

    • Method Detail

      • regionToPolygon

        public abstract java.awt.Polygon regionToPolygon(GeographicArea r)
        Transforms the given GeographicArea object into a polygon suitable for drawing.
        Parameters:
        r - region object to be transformed.
        Returns:
        polygon representing the region in the appropriate map projection.

      • getScale

        public abstract double getScale()
        Factor that the map points are scaled by.
        Returns:
        double representing the conversion scaled between spring2015code.gui space and map.modle space.

      • latToY

        public abstract double latToY(double lat)
        Converts a latitude point to a y value.
        Parameters:
        lat - latitude measurement to be converted.
        Returns:
        double y, in spring2015code.gui/Cartesian space.

      • lonToX

        public abstract double lonToX(double lon)
        Converts a longitude point to a y value.
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude measurement to be converted.
        Returns:
        double x, in spring2015code.gui/Cartesian space.

      • mapPointToPoint

        public abstract java.awt.Point mapPointToPoint(MapPoint mp)
        Converts a point on a map given in latitude and longitude, and transforms it into an x,y point on a Cartesian system, suitable for drawing.
        Parameters:
        mp - point defined in map space.
        Returns:
        converted point.

      • pointToMapPoint

        public abstract MapPoint pointToMapPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D p)
        in the inverse function of mapPointToPoint. Given a point in Cartesian space, returns a point in the map space.
        Parameters:
        p - point defined in spring2015code.gui space
        Returns:
        converted point.

      • getLatLonGrid

        public abstract java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Line2D> getLatLonGrid()
        Returns a conventional grid in latitude and longitude as defined by the converter.
        Returns:
        list of line2d objects representing a grid.

      • getProjectionDimensions

        public abstract java.awt.geom.Dimension2D getProjectionDimensions()
        Returns the dimensions of the projection of this converter. This really only makes sense for rectangular converters; Use accordingly.
        Returns:
        projection dimensions

      • getWidth

        public abstract double getWidth()
        Returns the width of the projection of this converter. The implementation of this may not be what is expected if the projection is non-rectangular.
        Returns:
        width of the projection

      • getHeight

        public abstract double getHeight()
        Returns the height of the projection of this converter. The implementation of this may not be what is expected if the projection is non-rectangular.
        Returns:
        height of the projection
